ab.title: Deuteronomy 11
ab.l: And you shall love the Lord your God and keep his charge and his statutesand his judgments and his commandments every day.
And you shall know today that it is not with your children whodid not know and did not see the reprimand of the Lord your God,his greatness, his strong hand andhis outstretched arm,
And his miracles,and his deeds which he did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh,king of Egypt, and to all his land,

And what he didto the army of Egypt: to their horses and to their chariots, howhe flowed the waters of the Red Sea over their faceswhen they pursued you, and how the Lord has destroyed them tothis day,
And what he did to you in the wildernessuntil you came to this place,

And what he didto Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab, son of Reuben,how the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up andtheir households and their tents and allthe prey that was at their side, in the midst of all Israel,
Because it is your eyes that saw all the great deeds of the Lordwhich he did.
And you shall keep all thecommandments which I command you this day, so that you may get strongand come and inherit the land that you are crossingthere to inherit it,
And so that you may prolongyour days in the land, which the Lord swore to your fathers to giveto them and to their offspring, a land flowing |with| milk andhoney.

Because the land, where you are coming to inheritit, is not as the land of Egypt, from where you came out,where you sowed your seed, and it was necessary to waterit with your foot, as a garden of grass.
Butthe land to which you are crossing to inherit it is a land of mountains andvalleys, and it drinks water from the rain of the skies.
A land which the Lord your God explores: the eyesof the Lord your God are always on it, from the beginning of the year to the endof the year.
And it shall be, if you will indeed listen to my commandmentswhich I command you today, to love the service of the Lordyour God and to serve him with all your heart and with allyour soul,
Then I will give you the rain of your land in its due times,the summer rain and the autumn rain, that you may gatherin your grain and your must and your olive oil.
And you will eatand be full, and I will also give grass in your fields for your cattle.
Take heed to yourselves, lest your heart be deceivedand you turn aside from the good way and serve othergods and worship them,

Andthe Lord’s anger will be kindled against you, and he will shut up the heaven,and there will be no rain, and that the land will not give its fruit,and you will perish quickly from off the good land which the Lordyour God is giving you.
And you shall lay up these my wordsin your heart and in your soul, and bindthem for a sign on your hand that they may be as frontletsbetween your eyes,
And you shall teachthem to your children, to speak about them when you sit in your houseand when you walk by the way and before you lie down andafter you rise,
And you shall write them in a way on the doorpostsof your house, and on your gates, so thatthe words of the Law may always be in your mind,
So that yourdays may be multiplied, and the days of your children, on the landwhich the Lord swore to your fathers to give them,as the days of the skies and the earth.
Because, if you will indeed keep all these commandmentswhich I command you, to do it, to love the serviceof Lord your God, to walk in all his ways, andto cling to his service:
Then the Lord will destroyall these kingdoms before you, andyou shall inherit kingdoms greater and mightierthan you.
Every place on which the soles of your feetshall step will be yours, from the wilderness and Lebanon,from the great river, the river Euphrates, to the westernsea will be your border.
Not a man will be able to standbefore you. The Lord your God will put your fear of your dreadon all the faces of all the land that you shall stepon, as he spoke to you.Parashat Reʾeh
See: I am givingbefore you today a blessing and a curse.
The blessing: if you listen to the commandments of the Lord your Godwhich I command you this day.
And the curse:if you do not listen to the commandments of the Lord your God, but goaside from the way which I command you today, to go after the serviceof other gods, which you have not known.
And it shall be,when the Lord your God will bring you to the land to which you are comingto inherit it, that you shall put the blessing on MountGerizim, and the curse on MountEbal.
Lo, they are at the ford of Jordan,on the west |side|, by the way where the sun goes down, in the landof the Canaanites who dwell in the steppe oppositeGilgal, beside the lands of plains of Moreh.
Because youare passing over Jordan to come to inherit theland which the Lord your God is giving you. And when you inheritit and dwell therein,
Then you shall be watchfulto do all the statutes and judgmentswhich I set before you today.
